intro: Swertia parallela, commonly known as the Himalayan gentian, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge. Swertia parallela is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing benefits.
